title: [BUG] evaluate method y_true y_pred inconsistency
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
After upgrading to 0.12.0, in `evaluate` method,  I got the warning: `UserWarning: y_pred and y_true do not have the same column index`. I guess it is because, `y_pred` doesn't have `y_true` ' s column name in its name. It is somehow removed during inner convertion processes. 


**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sktime.datasets import load_longley
from sktime.forecasting.arima import ARIMA
import numpy as np
from sktime.forecasting.model_evaluation import evaluate
from sktime.forecasting.model_selection import ExpandingWindowSplitter

y, X = load_longley()

fh = np.arange(1,3)

model = ARIMA()

df = evaluate(
    forecaster=model,
    cv=ExpandingWindowSplitter(fh=fh),
    y=y,
    X=X,
)
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
No warning should be given

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
